value.halfverse: protect me from those who rise up against me.
value.verse: Rescue me from my enemies, O God; *
Rescue me from evildoers *
value.halfverse: and save me from those who thirst for my blood.
not for any offense or fault of mine, O LORD.
value.verse:
See how they lie in wait for my life,
how the mighty gather together against me; *

value.halfverse: they run and prepare themselves for battle.
value.verse: Not because of any guilt of mine *

value.halfverse: for you, LORD God of hosts, are Israel’s God.
value.verse: Rouse yourself, come to my side, and see; *

value.halfverse: show no mercy to those who are faithless and evil.
value.verse: Awake, and punish all the ungodly; *

value.halfverse: they snarl like dogs and run about the city.
value.verse: They go to and fro in the evening; *

value.halfverse: “For who,” they say, “will hear us?”
value.verse:
Behold, they boast with their mouths,
and taunts are on their lips; *

value.halfverse: you laugh all the ungodly to scorn.
value.verse: But you, O LORD, you laugh at them; *

value.halfverse: for you, O God, are my stronghold.
value.verse: My eyes are fixed on you, O my Strength; *

value.halfverse: God will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
value.verse: My merciful God comes to meet me; *
Slay them, O God, lest my people forget; *
value.halfverse:
send them reeling by your might
 and put them down, O Lord our shield.
let them be caught in their pride.
value.verse:
For the sins of their mouths, for the words of their lips,
for the cursing and lies that they utter, *

value.halfverse: make an end of them, and they shall be no more.
value.verse: Make an end of them in your wrath; *

value.halfverse: and to the ends of the earth.
value.verse: Let everyone know that God rules in Jacob, *
They go to and fro in the evening; *
value.halfverse: they snarl like dogs and run about the city.
and if they are not filled, they howl.
value.verse: They forage for food, *

value.halfverse: I will celebrate your love in the morning;
value.verse: For my part, I will sing of your strength; *

value.halfverse: a refuge in the day of my trouble.
value.verse: For you have become my stronghold, *
To you, O my Strength, will I sing; *
value.halfverse: for you, O God, are my stronghold and my merciful God.
